author: Filip Timotija
description: Minnesota law enforcement officials have identified the suspect in the deadly shooting of state Speaker Emerita Melissa Hortman (D) and her husband as Vance Boelter, 57.  The FBI has launched a manhunt for Boelter and a $50,000 award is being offered for information leading to his arrest and conviction in in the killing of Hortman…
title: FBI launches manhunt, $50,000 award for information on Minnesota suspect

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump is facing pressure as his administration grapples with unrest in Middle East as Israel and Iran continue to trade attacks. Israel’s initial attack on Thursday took out half a dozen of Iran’s top military generals, nuclear scientists and inflicted damage on Tehran’s nuclear facilities.  Israel’s initial strikes on Iran killed 78 people and…
title: Sunday shows preview: Trump faces pressure on Israel-Iran conflict; LA protest turmoil lingers

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Saturday over the phone for 50 minutes, where the two leaders discussed the Israel-Iran conflict and negotiations to end the three-year war in Ukraine, according to the Kremlin.  Putin told Trump about his Friday conversations with both Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Iran’s President Masoud…
title: Trump, Putin speak via phone about Israel-Iran conflict

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Top leaders condemned a Saturday attack on Minnesota Democratic lawmakers as party tensions boil across the country.  Speaker Emerita Melissa Hortman (D) and her husband were killed and State Sen. John Hoffman (D) and his wife were also shot multiple times in a “politically motivated” attack that was condemned by elected officials on both sides of…
title: Trump, lawmakers react to ‘horrific’ shooting of Minnesota legislators

author: Douglas MacKinnon, opinion contributor
description: Be it Ukraine or Iran, Trump has long warned against the horrors of nuclear war.
title: Neocons and hawks play dangerous games, while Gabbard and Carlson remind us of risk

author: Michael Bartiromo
description: It’s estimated that there are upwards of 5 million American expatriates currently living in countries throughout the world.
title: Which country do Americans most want to relocate to?

description: It’s estimated that there are upwards of 5 million American expatriates currently living in countries throughout the world.

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) on Saturday confirmed state Speaker Emerita Melissa Hortman (D) and her husband were killed in a fatal shooting being investigated as “politically motivated.” “My good friend and colleague, Speaker Melissa Hortman and her husband Mark were shot and killed early this morning in what appears to be a politically motivated…
title: Minnesota state lawmaker assassinated at her home

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: President Trump on Saturday shared his enthusiasm for the day’s festivities despite expected rainy weather conditions. “OUR GREAT MILITARY PARADE IS ON, RAIN OR SHINE,” Trump wrote Saturday morning on Truth Social. “REMEMBER, A RAINY DAY P[A]RADE BRINGS GOOD LUCK,” he wrote. “I’LL SEE YOU ALL IN D.C.” Saturday marks the 250th anniversary of the…
title: Trump shares enthusiasm for DC military parade ‘RAIN OR SHINE’

author: Benji Backer, opinion contributor
description: This is about economics, not ideology — business decisions, not politics.
title: The decline of coal isn’t a conspiracy — it’s the market reality

author: Geoff D. Porter, opinion contributor
description: The burgeoning dam dispute between Morocco and Algeria is hardly unique: Climate change is exacerbating water conflicts around the world.
title: How to avoid Africa’s next water war

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Iranian officials on Saturday signaled they could walk back their decision to not attend upcoming nuclear talks with the U.S., but said further negotiations were likely “meaningless” as the nation exchanges fire with Israel. Esmaeil Baghaei, Iran’s foreign ministry spokesperson, told reporters it is “still unclear what decision we will make for Sunday,” according to…
title: Iran calls US nuclear talks ‘meaningless’ after Israel attack

author: The Hill Staff
description: Washington is commemorating the 250th anniversary of the U.S. Army with festivities Saturday — which also happens to be President Trump’s 79th birthday. The president earlier this week cast the event as an opportunity for the country “to show off a little bit.” “I think it’s going to be great,” Trump told reporters at the…
title: Live updates: Washington gears up for Trump military parade as Israel-Iran tensions flare

author: Richard Whitmire, Opinion Contributor
description: One thing you won’t read about: serious solutions to the problem.
title: Our schools have a ‘boy problem’ and we need to talk about it

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Israel issued a stark warning to Iran on Saturday as the two nations continue to exchange fire: Stop the strikes or “Tehran will burn.” “If [Iranian Supreme leader Ayatollah Ali] Khamenei continue to fire missiles at the Israeli home front, Tehran will burn,” Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz wrote on social platform X following a…
title: Israel issues warning to Iran amid tit-for-tat strikes: ‘Tehran will burn’

author: Ken Winters and Naomi Schaefer Riley, opinion contributors
description: Research is showing that cannabis is more deleterious to young people than we previously believed.
title: No amount of marijuana is safe for teens

author: Steph Whiteside
description: The U.S. had warning the attacks would take place.
title: US should stay out of war in Middle East: Retired colonel

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: Washington is gearing up for an extraordinary display of military might on Saturday with a parade and festival to commemorate the 250th anniversary of the Army — a day that’s also President Trump’s 79th birthday. The event has drawn fire for its expected cost as well as its timing, with critics deeming it another example…
title: Five things to know about Trump’s $45 million military parade

author: Mike Lillis
description: Democrats on Capitol Hill can’t catch a break.  Just as Sen. Alex Padilla’s (D-Calif.) physical clash with Trump administration security officials had given them cause to unite on the otherwise divisive issue of immigration, Israel’s attack on Iran has shifted the national gaze onto yet another radioactive topic that has long split the party. While…
title: Israel-Iran conflict poses new dilemma for Democrats

author: Niall Stanage
description: President Trump faces a volatile, fast-moving global crisis as Israel and Iran teeter on the brink of all-out war. The situation is shifting by the moment in the wake of Israel’s attack on multiple sites in Iran in the early hours of Friday, local time. Iran launched a retaliatory barrage against Israel later on Friday.…
title: The Memo: Trump grapples with prospect of all-out Israel-Iran war

author: Brooke Migdon
description: The Trump administration has leaned heavily on Title IX in its effort to purge sports of transgender women and girls, but attorneys and experts on the 1972 civil rights law say its latest move will disproportionately affect girls who are not transgender. The Department of Energy is preparing to roll back a portion of Title…
title: Trump’s Energy Department proposes dismantling parts of Title IX allowing girls on boys’ teams

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: A new survey from the NBC Decision Desk Poll, powered by Survey Monkey, showed that 64 percent of Americans disapprove of the use of state funds for this weekend’s military parade. On Saturday starting at 6:30 p.m., 150 vehicles, 50 aircraft and 6,600 soldiers will parade the street of Washington, D.C., to mark the U.S.…
title: Two in three Americans oppose using tax money for military parade: poll

On Saturday starting at 6:30 p.m., 150 vehicles, 50 aircraft and 6,600 soldiers will parade the street of Washington, D.C., to mark the U.S.…
title: Two in three Americans oppose using tax money for military parade: poll

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: An Afghan man pleaded guilty to two terrorism-related offenses on Friday for plotting to carry out an Election Day attack.  Nasir Ahmad Tawhedi, 27, told investigators he and co-conspirator Abdullah Haji Zada planned to die as martyrs while targeting large groups of people on Nov. 5.  “By pledging allegiance to ISIS and plotting an attack…
title: Afghan man pleads guilty for plotting Election Day attack

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: U.S. Marines deployed to Los Angeles on Friday for the first time detained a civilian as part of a protest against federal immigration raids, U.S. Northern Command (Northcom) confirmed to The Hill. The Marines “temporarily detained a civilian earlier today,” Northcom said in a statement, adding that forces may temporarily detain an individual in specific…
title: Marines detain first civilian in LA amid immigration raid protests
